The study will compare the effectiveness of simulation training with traditional teaching methods in terms of information evaluation forms, student satisfaction and self-confidence scales in learning, and self-efficacy scales in monitoring and management of electronic fetal monitoring. The study will also evaluate the simulation design scale immediately after the first and second simulation applications. The study will be conducted in a university in France and will involve 68 participants who will be randomly assigned to either the experimental or control group. The experimental group will receive simulation training in electronic fetal monitoring management, while the control group will receive traditional teaching methods. The study will use a pre-test and post-test design to evaluate the effectiveness of the intervention. The primary outcome measures will be information evaluation forms, student satisfaction and self-confidence scales in learning, and self-efficacy scales in monitoring and management of electronic fetal monitoring. The secondary outcome measures will be simulation design scale immediately after the first and second simulation applications. The study will use a mixed-methods approach, combining quantitative and qualitative data collection and analysis methods. The results of the study will contribute to the development of effective simulation training programs in electronic fetal monitoring management for midwifery students.

272.summary:
Prolonged mechanical ventilation (PMV) and weaning failure are factors associated with prolonged hospital length of stay and increased morbidity and mortality. In addition to the individual challenges that stress patients and their families, the resource-intensive care these patients receive places a significant burden on the public health system. These burdens often persist over the long term, especially in the case of weaning failure with subsequent home mechanical ventilation (HMV).
This study will provide invaluable and in-depth knowledge of major sources of admission to ICU and will clarify the cause for the outcomes seen after prolonged mechanical ventilation in ICU admission, at Dessie comprehensive Hospital, the result of our study will also serve as a source or baseline information for future valuable researches to be undergone around the subject of interest.

The study will be conducted in Dessie Comprehensive Specialized Hospital from August 2023 to January 2024. The study will include all charts of critically ill patients on prolonged mechanical ventilation in the hospital during the study period. The primary outcome measure is the clinical outcome of critically ill patients undergoing prolonged mechanical ventilation. The study will use a bivariate and multivariate analysis to determine the predictors of mortality in critically ill patients on prolonged mechanical ventilation.

273.summary: Two strategies have both proven to be effective in reducing bleeding complications while preserving efficacy compared with maintaining long-term DAPT with aspirin and a potent P2Y12 inhibitor: a) DAPT de-escalation (i.e., switching from prasugrel or ticagrelor to clopidogrel while maintaining aspirin) and b) potent P2Y12 inhibitor monotherapy (i.e., maintaining prasugrel or ticagrelor and dropping aspirin). These strategies have been tested in a number of trials and have led to changes in practice guidelines to consider either one of these strategies as bleeding reduction approaches among ACS patients undergoing PCI. However, comparative assessments between DAPT de-escalation and potent P2Y12 inhibitor monotherapy are lacking.

The first strategy is DAPT de-escalation, which involves switching from a potent P2Y12 inhibitor (prasugrel or ticagrelor) to clopidogrel while maintaining aspirin. The second strategy is potent P2Y12 inhibitor monotherapy, which involves maintaining the potent P2Y12 inhibitor (prasugrel or ticagrelor) and dropping aspirin. The primary outcome measure is the area under the curve (AUC) of thrombus formation measured by the Total Thrombus formation Analysis System (T-TAS) at 30 days. The trial aims to determine which strategy is more effective in reducing bleeding complications while maintaining ischemic efficacy.

The goal of this intervention study is to determine whether consumption of different fractions of chicken eggs, including egg whites, egg yolks, and whole eggs, confer different changes in markers of HDL function and T cell profiles in younger vs. older men and women. Objective 2: Determine if daily consumption of egg fractions differentially alter immune cell profiles across age groups.

The investigators propose to evaluate the efficacy of MyoTrain AR in a prospective clinical study involving 10 individuals with trans-radial upper-limb loss over a period of 35 days. These individuals will be randomized to Group A (Control Group using conventional motor imagery exercises) and Group B (who will train with the MyoTrain AR system pre-prosthetically).

276.summary:
The goal of this clinical trial is to investigate the effect of gastrointestinal stimulation with a pacemaker on the length of postoperative bowel paralysis in patients undergoing major abdominal surgery due to metastasizing colorectal cancer, appendiceal cancer or pseudomyxoma peritonei.

After surgery, patients will be asked to fill out a diary on bowel movements once a day.
